Rural Training Centre for up gradation of competency level of youth from SC ST OBC and Minority Regional Training Centre For 6 years JSS was operating regional training centre for the executive of JSS situated in Gujarat Maharastra Rajasthan and Chattishgadh NLM UNESCO 2004 Award JSS is awarded NLM UNESCO 2004 award for performance in the field of vocational training and skill up gradation programme for up liftmen of tribal belt population of Bharuch Dist

address: Kadamb Centre For Dance Opp:Parimal Garden C.G.Road Ahmedabad380 006
title: kadamb centre for dance
detailsOfAchievement: ABOUT KADAMB .. Kadamb , Centre for Dance and Music was started in 1967 with the purpose of promoting the appreciation of Kathak dance in Ahmedabad and in the State of Gujarat. With 35 years of efforts and commitment Kadamb has gained the reputation of an institution which imparts training in kathak dance and a holistic view of dance education. At Kadamb we encourage students to take many programs relating to dance . A number of our students are working professionally in various fields of dance such as choreography , research, teaching , performing and writing . Kadambâ€™s dance company is one of the most outstanding performing groups in the country . It has a unique style of its own . Creative innovations and an intelligent approach , in themes and choreography , have provided new dimension to the Kathak dance technique and has made a very strong visual impact . Kadambâ€™s performing unit has produced over seventy dance productions which have been staged and appreciated by audiences throughout India. The group has given a number of performances and participated in dance festivals in many countries around the world. Kadambâ€™s forte is the manifestation of creative imagination in dance choreography , danced by highly trained and proficient dancers . A training in strict classicism has opened various new areas in artistic expression . Kadambâ€™s path breaking contribution and its choreographic skills have made considerable impression on the dance community in India as also on dancers in other parts of the world. For the past 25 years Kadambâ€™s performing group has enjoyed wide popularity and a busy touring season throughout India and abroad. Countries where Kadamb performed are .. USA, UK, USSR, Sweden , Germany, Seychelles, Portugal, Indonesia, Thailand, Mongolia, China, Korea, Pakistan, Brazil, Bangladesh, Nepal, Bhutan , Japan, Singapore and Canada. In the year 2011 -2012 more than one hundred students are taking training in Kathak dance at various levels at Kadamb . Kadambâ€™s dance ensemble is one of the most outstanding performing companies in India. The renowned Kathak legend Padma Bhushan Kumudini Lakhia started the institution in 1967 and has invested a life time contribution in promoting and propagating the classical Kathak dance to the generations now and next. Her creative innovations and imaginative approach of the time and space concept has created a unique style of its own. A celebrated group of dancers who have had an extensive training in Kathak at Kadamb are known for their virtuosity, precision and elegance. Kadamb has given the Indian dance scene a number of dancers who are now well known in their own right nationally and internationally. The original score for Kadambâ€™s dance compositions has been composed by the eminent musician Atul Desai. Kadamb has grown into a highly acclaimed dance company that enjoys wide appreciation and immense popularity within India and abroad.

detailsOfAchievement: Kala Raksha Activities Income Generation- provide opportunity to earn through traditional art to more than 1,000 women artisans in 25 villages Capacity Building- have conducted design workshops with reputed designers over the past 21 years. Women are encouraged to innovate on their own traditions Have trained local people as professional staff, and 20 village people in professional tailoring Museum- 1997 established Kala Raksha Textile Museum. Today the excellently documented collections are digitally catalogued, archivally housed and accessible on the world wide web Education- since 1997 conducted functional literacy/ awareness workshops with artisans Health- since 1997 conducted preventive health care/ education workshops Micro Credit- have established self help savings groups among artisans in 6 villages Earthquake Rehabilitation- Post 2001 Kutch earthquake, independently raised funds and coordinated the reconstruction of an entire village (124 homes) and three sub centers. Provided financial assistance on matching grant basis for one year to all artisan constituency Kala Raksha Vidhyalaya Established the first Design School for Artisans, with financial support from The D C (Handicrafts) Government of India, UNESCO and private donors- 122 students have completed the one year course Achievements Presented at Textile Society of America symposium: Kala Raksha: from Cultural Identity to Intellectual Property Six women collaborated with students of the Art Institute Vittoria of Trento in an exhibition, Deserts and Mountains - East and West of the World, which won a prize for peace dedicated to Giancarlo Bettiol Launch of Kala Raksha online museum www.kala-raksha-museum.org Chief Executive Prakash Bhanani was nominated as a member of the Steering Committee (Handicrafts) under the National Planning Commission Govt. of India.. He attended a meeting in Delhi on 24 March, 2006 On November 29, Kala Raksha was honoured on a Special Cover, and with a cancellation stamp by the Indian Postal Service 2012-EdelGive Social Innovation Honours (ESIH)- Runner up for Livelihood innovation 2008- UNESCO Seal of Excellence Award 2001-Honoree of the International Responsible Tourism Showcase 2004-Winner of Crafts Council of Indiaâ€™s Sanmaan award for best game (Snakes and Ladders)
